availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James C. Blick (Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, coal merchant)

body.p: Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, coal merchant. Maryland native. Son of William Blick and Mary Blick. Married to Isabella Blick. Father of Charles D. Blick, Isabelle M. Blick. Married to Amelia J. Tobin Blick in Kenton County on July 11, 1865. Carpenter in Baltimore, Maryland, in 1850. Employed Robert Padget as a carpenter in Baltimore in 1850. Coal merchant in Kenton County in 1860. Employed Kate Dugan as a servant in Kenton County in 1860. Coal merchant in Kenton County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Maryland, Baltimore County, Baltimore Ward 8, p. 437B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 4, p. 685.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 1, p. 322A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Kenton County Marriages, Film #001943299, pp. 23-24.
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport â€“ Microfilm (before 1911), KDLA, Roll #7013568: Covington, Certificates 1-962 (1901), certificate #93, p. 97 of microfilm.
